optimize API reference¶

Models¶

class optimize.models.MixedModel¶

Bases: dict

class optimize.models.Model(p0=None, data=None, builder=None, args_to_pass=None, kwargs_to_pass=None, kernel=None)¶

Bases: object

Constructs a Bayesian base model for optimization. This class is useful to instantiate for simple Bayesian optimization problems.

p0¶

The initial parameters to use. Defaults to None.

Type

Parameters, optional

data¶

The dataset.

Type

MixedData, optional

builder¶

Defines the model to use. Any methods that construct the model will start at the build method, which 1. must be called as build(pars) and 2. by default calls builder(*args_to_pass, **kwargs_to_pass). A second option is to extend the Model class and implement one’s own build method.

Type

callable

args_to_pass¶

The arguments to pass to the build method. Defaults to ().

Type

tuple, optional

kwargs_to_pass¶

The keyword arguments to pass to the build method. Defaults to {}.

Type

dict, optional

kernel¶

The noise kernel to use.

Type

NoiseKernel

Constructs a base model for optimization.

Parameters

  • p0 (Parameters, optional) – The initial parameters to use. Defaults to None.

  • data (MixedData, optional) – The dataset, must be identical to kernel.data.

  • builder (callable) – Defines the model to use. Any methods that construct the model will start at the build method, which 1. must be called as build(pars) and 2. by default calls builder(*args_to_pass, **kwargs_to_pass). A second option is to extend the Model class and implement one’s own build method.

  • args_to_pass (tuple, optional) – The arguments to pass to the build method. Defaults to ().

  • kwargs_to_pass (dict, optional) – The keyword arguments to pass to the build method. Defaults to {}.

  • kernel (NoiseKernel) – The noise kernel to use.

build(pars)¶

Builds the model.

Parameters

pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use to build the model.

Returns

The constructed model.

Return type

np.ndarray

set_pars(pars)¶

Simple setter method for the parameters that may be extended.

Parameters

pars (Parameters) – The new starting parameters to use.

class optimize.models.PyMC3Model(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: optimize.models.Model, pymc3.model.Model

Constructs a base model for optimization.

Parameters

  • p0 (Parameters, optional) – The initial parameters to use. Defaults to None.

  • data (MixedData, optional) – The dataset, must be identical to kernel.data.

  • builder (callable) – Defines the model to use. Any methods that construct the model will start at the build method, which 1. must be called as build(pars) and 2. by default calls builder(*args_to_pass, **kwargs_to_pass). A second option is to extend the Model class and implement one’s own build method.

  • args_to_pass (tuple, optional) – The arguments to pass to the build method. Defaults to ().

  • kwargs_to_pass (dict, optional) – The keyword arguments to pass to the build method. Defaults to {}.

  • kernel (NoiseKernel) – The noise kernel to use.
